decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to establish early board presence with small creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Delver of Secrets, while controlling the game with countermagic like Counterspell and removal like Skred and Lightning Bolt. The deck also aims to maintain card advantage through card draw spells like Gush and can generate additional value through the card draw ability of Ninja of the Deep Hours. The inclusion of Augur of Bolas and cantrips like Brainstorm, Preordain, and Ponder help to ensure consistency in drawing relevant cards.

The focus of this deck is to apply pressure on the opposing player through the use of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours early in the game, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of damage while controlling the opponent's board with counterspells and bounce effects. The goal is to outpace the opponent and disrupt their game plan, ultimately securing victory through a combination of tempo advantage and card advantage.

This deck focuses on using various control elements such as Duress and Chainer's Edict to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also utilizing cards like Prismatic Strands and Pestilence to control the board. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by generating card advantage through cards like Night's Whisper and Palace Sentinels, while also employing life gain and resilient creatures like Aven Riftwatcher and Wall of Hope to stabilize against aggressive strategies. The deck has a strong Orzhov theme with lands that provide additional utility, making it a versatile and efficient control deck in the Pauper format.

The main concept of this Mono Green Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing low-cost creatures and powerful pump spells like Rancor, Vines of Vastwood, and Hunger of the Howlpack, the deck aims to quickly build up a threatening board presence. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Nettle Sentinel and Quirion Ranger allow for efficient mana usage and consistent pressure on the opponent. By maintaining a steady flow of threats and leveraging combat tricks, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with low-cost creatures like Nivix Cyclops and Kiln Fiend, while using spells like Temur Battle Rage, Mutagenic Growth, and Lightning Bolt to deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also features card draw and selection with Preordain, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to ensure that the player can maintain momentum and find the cards they need to push for a win. The inclusion of Apostle's Blessing and Artful Dodge allows for protection and evasion to help secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly applying pressure and controlling the game with efficient counterspells and removal spells. By utilizing cheap creatures like Faerie Miscreant and Delver of Secrets, as well as the card advantage provided by Ninja of the Deep Hours, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while maintaining a steady stream of threats. The inclusion of Skred as a removal spell that can scale with the amount of Snow mana available allows the deck to have versatile answers to a wide variety of threats.

This deck focuses on quickly dropping cheap artifacts onto the battlefield to power up your creatures and create a fast, aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards such as Springleaf Drum and Prophetic Prism, you can easily flood the board with artifacts to reduce the cost of cards like Myr Enforcer and Gearseeker Serpent. With plenty of artifact creatures and spells like Galvanic Blast and Temur Battle Rage, you can overwhelm your opponent with a relentless assault before they have a chance to react.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to efficiently use small creatures and burn spells to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, along with creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk, the deck aims to deal damage early and consistently. The addition of card draw and recursion elements like Prophetic Prism and Battle Screech helps maintain momentum and card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive tactics to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory in a Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of aggressive Elves while generating lots of mana and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Wellwisher and Timberwatch Elf, you can gain incremental life and pump up your creatures to deal massive amounts of damage. With the help of cards like Distant Melody and Quirion Ranger, you can keep your hand full of resources while efficiently using your mana. This deck aims to quickly build a board presence and snowball into a victory before your opponent can establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts to fuel the aggressive strategy of the Affinity archetype. By utilizing cards like Springleaf Drum, Flayer Husk, and Chromatic Star, the deck can amass a board presence and generate mana efficiently. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Atog and Gearseeker Serpent, along with burn spells like Galvanic Blast to close out the game swiftly. Thoughtcast helps to draw into more threats, while cards like Prophetic Prism provide additional card draw and fixing. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent aggressive assault.

The foundation of this deck is built on maximizing mana efficiency and exploiting artifacts to quickly overwhelm opponents with a barrage of cheap, powerful creatures and burn spells. By using cards like Springleaf Drum, Prophetic Prism, and Chromatic Star to produce mana and draw cards, along with creatures like Myr Enforcer, Frogmite, and Carapace Forger, this deck aims to flood the board with threats early on. Additionally, cards like Galvanic Blast and Fling provide direct damage to finish off opponents or clear the way for a final attack.

The main concept of the deck is to play aggressively with efficient faerie creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Ninja of the Deep Hours to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes card draw and counterspells to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Delver of Secrets and Augur of Bolas adds versatility and consistency to the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while efficiently countering the opponent's spells to secure a victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying efficient threats while also providing card advantage through repeatable card draw effects like Ichor Wellspring and Glint Hawk. Combining cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast with creatures that can generate value like Thraben Inspector and Kor Skyfisher, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a steady stream of threats to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells like Firebolt and Rally the Peasants to close out games or clear blockers.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays early in the game to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient counterspells, it aims to maintain tempo and apply pressure through evasive threats like Ninja of the Deep Hours. The deck also includes card draw and bounce spells to ensure consistency and disrupt the opponent's board state. Overall, it looks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption while leveraging the power of aerial creatures for added advantage.

This deck focuses on a tempo-based strategy with a heavy emphasis on cheap, efficient spells and creatures. It aims to control the board with counterspells and removal while deploying evasive threats like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Delver of Secrets. The deck also utilizes card selection spells like Ponder and Preordain to maintain consistency and maximize efficiency. Additionally, the deck benefits from the synergy between Faerie Miscreant and Spellstutter Sprite to generate additional value and disrupt opposing strategies.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy threats in the early game and maintain tempo by disrupting the opponent with counterspells and removal. Utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, the deck aims to apply pressure while drawing cards and controlling the board. By combining aggro and midrange elements, this deck seeks to outpace the opponent and control the game through card advantage and versatile spells. Additionally, the use of snow-covered lands allows for additional synergies with cards like Skred and Gush, enhancing the deck's overall strategy.

The main focus of this Dimir Control Pauper deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal like Doom Blade and Chainer's Edict, while also generating card advantage with spells like Forbidden Alchemy and Mulldrifter. By using these tools, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind them out of resources, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of card advantage and efficient threat management.

This deck is focused on utilizing artifact creatures and cheap artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while also maintaining card advantage through card draw spells. The key strategy is to use cards like Springleaf Drum and Prophetic Prism to ramp up quickly and play powerful threats like Myr Enforcer and Gearseeker Serpent. The deck also includes burn spells like Galvanic Blast for reach and removal, with the potential for a surprise finish with Fling or Temur Battle Rage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. The use of efficient pump spells and combat tricks helps to increase the damage output of the creatures, while also maintaining board presence and resilience. The inclusion of cards like Skarrgan Pit-Skulk and Silhana Ledgewalker provide evasion and difficult-to-block threats, further enhancing the deck's aggressive strategy. This deck aims to consistently apply pressure to the opponent and win the game through fast and relentless attacks.

The main focus of this deck is to consistently deal damage to the opponent through a combination of direct burn spells, triggered abilities, and creatures that tap to deal damage. By utilizing a low-cost, aggressive playstyle, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can establish a strong board presence. With a high concentration of direct damage spells and efficient creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of burn damage.
